messages.author: Ryan Sleevi (OoO until 11-18)
messages.text:
Comment nit: Chromium comments discourage the use of pronouns - see https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/topic/chromium-dev/NH-S6KCkr2M/discussion


"True if the enforcement of the minimum SSL/TLS version for preloaded HSTS entries is disabled."

messages.author: agl
messages.text:
I don't think version_fallback makes sense here. It's not like we can have fallen back at this point.

|sni_available| is designed to remove HSTS requirements when SNI isn't sent (i.e. SSLv3) and we didn't want to do that under the attackers control - i.e. when falling back.

In this case, since we're setting TLSv1 to be the minimum version then SNI is always sent. Thus I think this should always just be true.

messages.author: Ryan Sleevi (OoO until 11-18)
messages.text: nit: net/ style is to omit braces on one-line if statements.

messages.author: agl
messages.text:
server_ssl_config_for_testing()

(If it's a testing function then let's make it really clear.)

Alternatively, it looks like the style here is to use FRIEND_TEST_ALL_PREFIXES for the tests.

messages.text:

> 
> (If it's a testing function then let's make it really clear.)
> 
> Alternatively, it looks like the style here is to use FRIEND_TEST_ALL_PREFIXES
> for the tests.

+1 to either FRIEND_TEST_ALL_PREFIXES or friending the test fixture and adding a protected getter to the test fixture for the individual tests.
